text.0: i call on dadhikrās the first to give you aid the aśvins bhaga dawn and agni kindled well.
text.1: indra and viṣṇu pūṣan brahmaṇaspati Ādityas heaven and earth the waters and the light.
text.2: when rising to the sacrifice we hasten awaking dadhikrās with adorations.
text.3: seating on sacred grass the goddess iḷā let us invoke the sage swifthearing aśvins.
text.4: while i am thus arousing dadhikrāvan i speak to agni earth and dawn and sūrya.
text.5: the red the brown of varuṇa ever mindful may they ward off from us all grief and trouble.
text.6: foremost is dadhikrāvan vigorous courser in forefront of the cars his way he knoweth.
text.7: closely allied with sūrya and with morning Ādityas and aṅgirases and vasus.
text.8: may dadhikrās prepare the way we travel that we may pass along the path of order.
text.9: may agni bear us and the heavenly army hear us all mighty ones whom none deceiveth.
